intro: Aporuellia borneensis, commonly known as the Borneo bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with slender stems and narrow leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in undergrowth areas of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
